intro: Funastrum rupicola, commonly known as the rock funastrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are typically borne in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Funastrum rupicola is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to challenging growing conditions.
